Internationalization Functions Collator
&reftitle.intro;
Internationalization extension (further is referred as Intl) is a wrapper for ICU library, enabling PHP programmers to perform UCA-conformant collation and date/time/number/currency formatting in their scripts.
It tends to closely follow ICU APIs, so that people having experience working with ICU in either C/C++ or Java could easily use the PHP API. Also, this way ICU documentation would be useful to understand various ICU functions.
Intl consists of several modules, each of them exposes the corresponding ICU API:
Collator: provides string comparison capability with support for appropriate locale-sensitive sort orderings.
Formatter: allows to display number according to the localized format or given pattern or set of rules, and to parse strings into numbers.
&reftitle.required;
To build the extension you need to install the ICU library of version 3.6+.
You will also need the latest version of PHP. Collator is known to work well on PHP 5.1.3+ and 5.2.0+.
&reference.intl.configure;
Testing
Run:
$ make test
Note that the tests may fail if:
you have already enabled collator extension in your php.ini;
you use LD_LIBRARY_PATH to load ICU libraries and value of the 'variables_order' setting in php.ini doesn't contain letter 'E' (missing 'E' means "do not register Environment variables");
Installation
Run:
$ make install
Then enable the extension by adding the following line to [PHP] section of your php.ini:
extension=intl.so
Using
Each module provides two kind of APIs: a procedural one and an object oriented one. Both are actually identical and described in the corresponding document.
Note: All input strings must be in UTF-8 encoding. All output strings are also in UTF-8.
Example of using the procedural API
<?php $coll = collator_create( 'en_US' ); $result = collator_compare( $coll, "string#1", "string#2" ); ?>
Example of using the object-oriented API
<?php $coll = new Collator( 'en_US' ); $al = $coll->getLocaleByType( ULOC_ACTUAL_LOCALE ); echo "Actual locale: $al\n";
$formatter = new NumberFormatter( 'en_US', NumberFormatter::DECIMAL ); echo $formatter->format( 1234567 ); ?>
&reftitle.classes;
Collator
Constructors
Collator::__construct() - create a collator
Collator::create()- creates a new instance of Collator. This method is useful when you prefer just to get null on error, as if you called collator_create.
&reftitle.methods;
getErrorCode() - get collator's last error code.
getErrorMessage() - return error text for the last ICU operation.
compare() - compare two strings using PHP strcmp semantics.
sort() - equivalent to standard PHP sort using Collator.
asort() - sort array maintaining index association.
sortWithSortKeys() - similar to Collator::sort(). Uses ICU ucol_getSortKey() to gain more speed on large arrays.
getAttribute() - get collation attribute value.
setAttribute() - set collation attribute.
getStrength() - get current collation strength.
setStrength() - set collation strength.
getLocale() - get the locale name of the collator.
getDisplayName() - get the display name for a locale.
getAvailableLocales() - get a list of all locales for which a valid collator may be opened.
Functions
These are actually the same as Collator class methods.
collator_create() - create collator.
collator_compare() - compare two strings
collator_sort() - sort array using specified collator.
collator_asort() - sort array maintaining index association.
collator_sort_with_sort_keys() - similar to collator_sort. Uses ICU ucol_getSortKey() to gain more speed on large arrays.
collator_get_locale() - gets the locale name of the collator.
collator_get_display_name() - get the display name for a locale.
collator_get_available_locales() - get a list of all locales for which a valid collator may be opened.
collator_get_attribute() - get collation attribute value.
collator_get_strength() - get current collation strength.
collator_set_strength() - set collation strength.
collator_set_attribute() - set collation attribute.
collator_get_error_code() - get collator's last error code.
collator_get_error_message() - get text for collator's last error code.
